pullRequest.body:
Given `W : MorphismProperty C`, define `W.MultiplicativeClosure` to be the morphism property obtained by adding identities, and inductively adding compositions on the left by morphism satisfying `W`. We show this is the smallest multiplicative morphism property greater or equal than `W`, and that it is equal to the one defined similarly but with right composition instead.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

Implements what was suggested in #21743 and #21741. I did not state any direct inductive principle as they seem to be baked in the definitions anyways, but perhaps a lemma named `multiplicativeClosure_eq_top` stating such a principle might be desirable?

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [a5bfdd73a2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21864/commits/a5bfdd73a2db72ee8145021a89f6951ebcc7c0c6)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ eq_prime`
`+ eq_self_of_isMultiplicative`
`+ instance : IsMultiplicative W.multiplicativeClosure`
`+ instance : IsMultiplicative W.multiplicativeClosure'`
`+ le_of_isMultiplicative_le`
`+ le_of_isMultiplicative_le_iff`
`+ multiplicativeClosure`
`+ multiplicativeClosure'`
`+ multiplicativeClosure_monotone`
`+ self_le`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
My suggestion is not to define `MultiplicativeClosure'`, but to provide an alternative induction principle.

It may be necessary or convenient to define `MultiplicativeClosure'` to prove this, so maybe the docstring should make clear that the better API is `multiplicativeClosure`, but in case the user needs the other induction principle (and basically only in this case), they can use `eq_prime`.
Yeah, it seems that proving directly the induction principle without this helper isnt that straightforward... Ill leave it and document it as you say.
I would prefer this is `multiplicativeClosure`. This is both a "type" and a term in `MorphismProperty`, but the `MorphismProperty` API favours the latter (e.g. `MorphismProperty.llp/retracts/etc`).

```suggestion
lemma self_le : W  multiplicativeClosure W := fun {_ _} _ hf  .of _ hf
```
(Actually, we may also use dot notation : `W.multiplicativeClosure`.)
It would be nice to have a `multiplicativeClosure_le_iff` asserting `W.multiplicativeClosure  W'` iff `W  W'` under the `W'.IsMultiplicative` assumption.

```suggestion
/-- Given a morphism property `W`, `multiplicativeClosure W` is the smallest
```

```suggestion
/-- A variant of `multiplicativeClosure` in which compositions are taken on the left rather than
```
I would suggest moving lemmas in the `MorphismProperty` namespace, e.g. `MorphismProperty.le_multiplicativeClosure`.
I think it would not be harmful to declare this as a separate declaration (instance).

pullRequest.title: feat(CategoryTheory/MorphismProperty/Composition): multiplicative closure of a `MorphismProperty`
